alert.note: Alert for Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 20 at 11:11AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow showers will affect central Oxford and east central Coos Counties... At 1111 AM EST...An area of heavy snow showers was 8 miles southeast of Grafton, or 8 miles northwest of Bethel...moving east AT 25 MPH. Locations impacted include... Bethel, Rumford, Dixfield, Andover, Grafton, Mexico, Greenwood, Hanover, Gilead, West Paris, Woodstock, Mason, Milton, Riley, Newry, Albany, Peru, Batchelders Grant, Shelburne and Upton. This also includes... Old Speck Mountain, Grafton Notch, Mount Success, Caribou Mountain, and Screw Auger Falls. * Winds in excess of 35 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes.
